laboratory_examinations.findings: Suggested generalized anhidrosis; paradoxical hyperhidrosis in upper trunk, neck, shoulders, and armpits.
Showed few scattered sweat droplets on thighs and on the back of hands and feet.
Sudomotor innervation appeared overall poor, with absent vasointestinal peptide (VIP)-ir nerves and unusually abundant dopamine/H9252-hydroxylase (DbH)-ir fibers in shoulder skin samples.

Showed minimal difference between mean diurnal and nocturnal values with blunted physiologic nocturnal fall; significant 24-hour fluctuation with normal MESOR, reduced amplitude, and slightly advanced acrophase.
